definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand

sentences.english: He was a man of much worldly wisdom, and in some ways resembled Voltaire.
sentences.chinese: 他精於人情世故，在某些方面酷似伏爾泰。

sentences.english: No one doubts that the Chevalier and Voltaire met and conversed.
sentences.chinese: 騎士先生和伏爾泰曾經會面和交談是確信無疑的。

sentences.english: In my younger days I read Voltaire's writings.
sentences.chinese: 我年輕的時候讀過伏爾泰的着作。

definition: Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), Italian Renaissance painter (Tw)
"Mr Science", phrase used during the May 4th Movement 五四運動|五四运动[Wu3 si4 Yun4 dong4]/abbr. for 賽因斯|赛因斯[sai4 yin1 si1]/see also 德先生[De2 xian1 sheng5]
